messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] husbands
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/11/2003 1:09:59 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... Aren t the ones that get it great? Not that the others aren t , but the ones that
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/11/2003 1:09:59 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
pamsoroosh@... writes:
> Sometimes I feel for my long-suffering husband - who goes along very
> lovingly with all of the changes - some quite radical - that I've
> brought into our lives. They are especially radical for him - he comes
> from an agricultural background - small town in Iran - very
> conservative and traditional.

Aren't the ones that "get it" great? Not that the others aren't <g>, but the
ones that lovingly accept what may be difficult for them? Ben has a very
conservative/traditionalc background too---small Southern town/the
Citadel/military service---but is quite agreeable to all the changes we've
made. He even had breakfast with his mother this morning---and she wants
websites/books/info about unschooling! WOW!!! She may even be at the
conference!!!

Anyway---Hats off to the hardworking dads that contribute in so many ways to
our unschooling!

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
